PageTitle: default-route imported (BGP-IPv4 multicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The default-route imported command configures MBGP to add default routes to the MBGP routing table.
The undo default-route imported command restores the default configuration.
By default, MBGP does not add default routes to the MBGP routing table.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To import default routes, you need to run both the default-route imported command and the import-route command. If only the import-route command is used, default routes cannot be imported. In addition, the default-route imported command is used to import only the default routes that exist in the local routing table.
When a device needs to advertise default routes to a peer or a peer group and no default route exists in the local routing table, the peer default-route-advertise command needs to be used.
